title: LFortran mode to warn when there is a conversion loss (double to single precision)
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/305

When you compile code like this:
```fortran
program test
  integer, parameter :: dp = kind(0.d0)
  real(dp), parameter :: const = 1.4435435345345
  real(dp), parameter :: const2 = 1./3.
  real(dp), parameter :: const3 = 1./4.

  print *, const
  print *, const2
  print *, const3

end program test
```
LFortran should have a warning that would warn that the constants will be downgraded to single precision, even when assigned to double precision. The user can prevent the warning by specifying precision explicitly, as in:
```fortran
  real(dp), parameter :: const = 1.4435435345345_dp
  real(dp), parameter :: const2 = 1./3._dp
  real(dp), parameter :: const3 = 1./4._dp
```


Related issue:

https://github.com/j3-fortran/fortran_proposals/issues/201
